briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of a FAI Insert in Subjects With Chronic Non-infectious Posterior Uveitis
officialTitle: A Multi-center, Controlled, Safety and Efficacy Study of a Fluocinolone Acetonide Intravitreal (FAI) Insert in Subjects With Chronic Non-infectious Uveitis Affecting the Posterior Segment of the Eye
summary: Phase 3, multi-center, randomized, masked, controlled study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of an injectable fluocinolone acetonide intravitreal (FAI) insert for the management of subjects with chronic non-infectious uveitis affecting the posterior segment of the eye. Patients will be randomized to receive either a sham injection or the FAI insert and will be observed for three years following treatment.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With Recurrence of Uveitis in Study Eye Within 6 Months
